contentList.content: Fire
Beyond the eight traditional schools of magic, Wizards can also specialize in mastering primordial elements like Fire.
Hot Streak

When you land a Critical Hit against an enemy using a Fire spell, the next Fire spell you cast costs a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> instead of an <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag>.
Heating Up

Activate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HOT_STREAK">Hot Streak!</LSTag> to make the next Fire spell you cast cost a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> instead of an <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag>.
Hot Streak!
The next Fire spell you cast costs a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> instead of an <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag>.
Critical Mass
The number you need to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">roll</LSTag> a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with Fire spells is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.
Ignite
Dealing Fire damage with a spell applies [1] turns of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING">Burning</LSTag> to the target.
Repeated applications cause an extra tick of Fire damage.
Flame Patch
Dealing Fire damage with a spell creates a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING">Burning</LSTag> surface on impact that lasts [1] turns.
Firestarter
Once per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, attacking a creature at full HP with a Fire Spell is a guaranteed Critical Hit.
Cauterize

Once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, if you drop to [1] <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit point</LSTag>, you regain [2] instead of being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DOWNED">Downed</LSTag> and gain <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Dash">Dash</LSTag>.
Frost
Beyond the eight traditional schools of magic, Wizards can also specialize in mastering the force of cold.
Shatter

When using a Cold spell against a creatue that is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FROZEN">Frozen</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE_ICE">Prone</LSTag> from an Ice Surface, your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack</LSTag> has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> and the number you need to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">roll</LSTag> a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> is reduced by [1]. This effect can stack.
Splitting Ice
Your Cold spells that would normally target only 1 creature can target an additional creature.
Fingers of Frost

Dealing Cold damage to a creature grants you [1] turns of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ICICLES">Icicles</LSTag>. You can expend [2] turns of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ICICLES">Icicles</LSTag> to make your next Cold spell benefit from <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Shatter">Shatter</LSTag> regardless of conditions.
Icicles
Accumulating Icicles from dealing Cold damage with Spells.
Expend [1] turns of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ICICLES">Icicles</LSTag> to make your next Cold spell benefit from <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Shatter">Shatter</LSTag> regardless of conditions.
Your next Cold spell benefit from <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Shatter">Shatter</LSTag> regardless of conditions.
Ice Block
Encase yourself in ice, becoming <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to damage but unable to move or take actions until the start of your next turn.
<LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to damage but unable to move or take actions until the start of your next turn.
Arcane
Beyond the eight traditional schools of magic, Wizards can also specialize in manipulating the very weave itself.
Savant
You now regain all your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery Charges</LSTag> after a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.
Clearcasting

You can directly cast spells using <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery Charges</LSTag> in place of a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag>. The cost is equal to the spell's level.

Whenever you expend a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag> in combat, you have a chance based on the spell's level to gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CLEARCASTING">Clearcasting</LSTag>, allowing you to cast your next spell without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag>.
The next spell you cast doesn't cost a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag>.
Arcane Power

You can spend <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery Charges</LSTag> to replace the primary <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrows">Saving Throw</LSTag> of a spell with an <LSTag Tooltip="Arcana">Arcana</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SkillCheck">check</LSTag> against 10 + the target's Level. The cost is equal to the spell's level, or 1 for cantrips.
Arcane Blast
Unleash pure arcane energy that always hits its target.
Bonuses to your passive <LSTag Tooltip="Arcana">Arcana</LSTag> score also increase the damage of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_ArcaneBlast">Arcane Blast</LSTag>.
Learn the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_ArcaneBlast">Arcane Blast</LSTag>spell.
Arcane Missiles

For each <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery Charge</LSTag> you spend, you can make your next cast of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_MagicMissile">Magic Missile</LSTag> shoot that many additional darts.

When you cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_MagicMissile">Magic Missile</LSTag>, you will expend <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ARCANE_MISSILES">Arcane Missiles</LSTag> stacks to shoot that many additional darts.
The maximum number of additional darts per cast is equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> modifier.
Presence of Mind

When spending <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery Charges</LSTag> to cast a spell, you can spend 1 extra to make the spell cost a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> instead of an <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag>.
Prismatic Barrier

When spending <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery Charges</LSTag>, gain <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to 5x the amount spent. While they remain active, you have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to damage from spells.
Arcane Intellect
You and other members of your party gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>.
Has a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>.
Arcane Surge

For each <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery Charge</LSTag> you spend on this spell, deal [1] and gain 1 turn of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ARCANE_SURGE">Arcane Surge</LSTag>, which adds [2] to all damage you deal with spells. During the duration, you can restore <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery Charges</LSTag> by killing enemies, up to the original amount spent.

Deal [1], and gain [2] turns of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ARCANE_SURGE">Arcane Surge</LSTag>, which adds [3] to all damage you deal with spells. During the duration, you can restore up to [2] <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery Charges</LSTag> by killing enemies.
Spell damage increased by [1].
Surging Urge
Killing an enemy will restore a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery Charge</LSTag>.
Learn the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_ArcaneSurge">Arcane Surge</LSTag> spell.
Evocation
Restore 1 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery Charge</LSTag> now, and 1 more at the start of each turn for [1] turns.
Restoring 1 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery Charge</LSTag> at the start of each turn.
Learn the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Evocation">Evocation</LSTag> spell.
Chronomancy

Beyond the eight traditional schools of magic, a select few Wizards specialize in the greatest magic of all...

No, not friendship, what the fuck is wrong with you? Friends die all the time! All this "Love is the greatest magic of all" bullshit--so, in a war, a mother and her children get fucking iced in alleyway outside their home, was the problem that they didn't love eachother enough? That's crazy! Love is not magic! Love is love, magic is magic, and the greatest magic of all is CHRONOMANCY!
Time Warp
<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HASTE">Hasten</LSTag> all nearby allies.
Alter Time

Alter the fabric of time, making you return to your current position and approximate HP total [1] turns after casting. You can spend a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> to activate this sooner.
Altering Time
Will return to the position and approximate HP total that the entity was at when casting <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_AlterTime">Alter Time</LSTag>.
Alter Time: Activate
Activate to teleport back to your previous position and return to approximately the same HP total.
Time Heals All Wounds
The list of spells you can learn is expanded to include a number of Healing spells not normally on the Wizard spell list.
Heightened Chronomancy

Enemies have Disadvantage on Saving Throws against your Slow spell.

Creatures that you apply the Haste condition to will be Slowed for 1 turn when it expires instead of becoming Lethargic.
Time Lord

Once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, when your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_AlterTime">Alter Time</LSTag> completes, you can also return to the total amount of <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag> you started with.
When your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_AlterTime">Alter Time</LSTag> completes, you will also return to the total amount of <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag> you started with.
